p: In this work, three varieties of cardamom (fruits/seeds) were purchased from a local market in Jeddah city (KSA) in 2014 including the green cardamom ( Elattaria cardamomum L. Manton), Ethiopian cardamom ( Aframomum corrorima) and black cardamom ( Amomum subulatum). The plants were identified by Pr. Al-Sieni Abdulbasit and voucher specimens were deposited in the CERTE (Technopark of Borj Cedria, Tunisia). One hundred grams of plant seeds were distilled for three hours with distilled water (500 mL) using a Clevenger-type apparatus [ 43]. The obtained essential oil was refrigerated in sealed glass vials at 4 Â°C until analysis.
